front.title: The IETF is for Everyone: Toward Inclusive and Equitable Participation in Internet Governance

abstract.t: This document affirms that the governance and activities of the IETF must be inclusive, accessible, and safe for all individuals, regardless of geography, language, race, gender, or sexual orientation. While the IETF promotes global Internet standards for everyone, structural and contextual barriers still limit the full and equal participation of many stakeholders, particularly from underrepresented regions and marginalized communities. This draft proposes key principles and recommendations to ensure that IETF meetings and processes reflect the foundational values of openness, diversity, inclusion, and non-discrimination.
